definition: to be fond of/to have a tendency to/to be prone to
good/well/proper/good to/easy to/very/so/(suffix indicating completion or readiness)/(of two people) close/on intimate terms/(after a personal pronoun) hello

sentences.english: The Arevaci are a warlike people.
sentences.chinese: 阿雷瓦西人是好战的族群。

sentences.english: "A whole nation of belligerent, snappish people?" asked Nikolai.
sentences.chinese: “一个全国好战的国家？急躁的人民？”尼可莱问。

sentences.english: Countries and their people get frustrated because they have so little.
sentences.chinese: 一个国家和她的人民变得好战是因为他们拥有的少。

sentences.english: Two other militant leaders gave up their weapons on Saturday.
sentences.chinese: 周六，其他两名好战分子领袖已经缴出武器。

sentences.english: Directed by the warlike Inanna, he penetrates the Sinai peninsula, invades Egypt.
sentences.chinese: 受到好战的伊娜娜指引，他渗透西奈半岛，入侵埃及。

sentences.english: The Afghans I met were neither xenophobic nor bellicose.
sentences.chinese: 我遇到的阿富汗人既不排外，也不好战。

sentences.english: There were also pugnacious certainties guaranteed to incite the war's critics.
sentences.chinese: 其中好战的言论肯定能激怒战争评论家。

sentences.english: The lasting we want it a trigger-happy general at the disarmament talks.
sentences.chinese: 在裁军会谈中我们最不喜欢的是好战的将军。

sentences.english: A militant attitude often betrays an inner turmoil.
sentences.chinese: 好战的姿态常常显露了内心的骚动。
这些好战的川普支持者。

sentences.english: This respect cannot be earned through belligerence.
sentences.chinese: 好战的态度无法赢得这种尊重。

sentences.english: Her increasing belligerence alienated her from her old friends.
sentences.chinese: 她的日益增长的好战性使她和她的老朋友们疏远了。

sentences.english: A whole nation of belligerent , snappish people ?
US is the biggest war monger and a oil thief.
sentences.chinese: 美国才是最大的好战者和石油窃贼。

sentences.english: Tactical communications network sufficiently militant signal equipment primarily.
sentences.chinese: 战术通信网足以好战通信装备为主。

definition: to promote a martial spirit/to revere military skills/warlike
see 桀驁不馴|桀骜不驯[jie2 ao4 bu4 xun4]
to be brave and good at fighting (idiom)
